title: Induction of BRCAness in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer by a CDK12/13 Inhibitor Improves Chemotherapy.
abstract: In this issue of Cancer Cell, Quereda and colleagues report that a newly developed specific inhibitor of CDK12/13, SR-4835, sensitizes triple-negative breast cancer cells to PARP inhibitors and DNA-damaging chemotherapeutics by reducing expression of the genes in the DNA damage response pathway.

authors.name: Jessica L Hopkins
affiliations: Massachusetts General Hospital Cancer Center, Harvard Medical School, Charlestown, MA 02129, USA.
